events.1581: Akbar, great Mughal Emperor, won Kabul.
events.1855: Alladiya Khan, famous singer of Kolhapur court, was born.
events.1860: Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande, the great architect of the renaissance of Hindustani music and who played a vital role in giving re-birth to North Indian classical music, was born at Balukeshwar, Maharashtra.
events.1894: Varahagiri Venkata Giri, the fourth former President of India, was born at Berhampur in Orissa. He was one of the patriarchs of Trade Union Movement of India.
events.1901: Narayan Pillai Gopala Pillai, great poet and educationist, was born in Quilon, Kerala.
events.1904: Japanese troups were defeated by the Russian Amry at Port Aurther.
events.1905: Sundarji Gokuldas Betard, modern Gujrathi poet, was born.
events.1927: Manali Kallat Vainu Bappu, first Indian astronomer, litterateur and Urdu poet, was born at Madras.
events.1930: In the 'Gandhi Cap Case' in Guntur, the magistrate prohibits wearing of Gandhi caps within a five-mile radius of the town.
events.1942: Manju Bala Patil was shot on the road at Mumbai by the British Police.
events.1979: Rohini Technology Payload (RTP) intended for measuring in-flight performance of first experimental flight of SLV-3, the first Indian Space launch vehicle, failed to be placed in orbit.
events.1982: Memorial of 201 martyrs from Maharashtra inaugurated.
events.1986: Gen. A.S. Vaidya, who was Chief of Army Staff, at the time of 'Operation Blue Star', was shot dead at Pune.
events.1988: Ramakrishna Hegde resigns as CM of Karnataka on moral grounds in connection with phone tapping issue.
events.1989: Panchayatraj' and 'Nagarpalika' bills were passed in Parliament's Lok Sabha.
events.1991: Delhi airport police foils an attempt by a Saudi national to smuggle out a minor girl named Ameena.
events.1992: P. P. Thorat, retired Lt and General, died.
events.1993: Narayan Keshav Upasni, famous educationist, passed away.
events.1994: President's rule in J&K extended for another 6 months beginning 3rd Sept.
events.1995: Harishankar Parsai, famous Hindi litterateur, passed away.
events.1998: Sri Bhuteshanandji Maharaj, 97, president of the Ramakrishna Math and Ramakrishna Mission, died in Calcutta.
events.2000: Parliament approves the Uttar Pradesh Reorganisation Bill to create a hilly state of Uttaranchal.
